definition: Toward or at the front of the body.
example_usage: The sternum is anterior to the heart.

definition: Toward or at the back of the body.
example_usage: The spine is posterior to the heart.

definition: Toward the front or belly side of the body.
example_usage: The ventral surface faces forward.

definition: Toward the back side of the body.
example_usage: The dorsal fin is on the back.

definition: Toward the head or upper part of structure.
example_usage: The head is superior to the neck.

definition: Away from the head or lower part of structure.
example_usage: The feet are inferior to the knees.

definition: Toward the head or cranium.
example_usage: Cranial nerves exit the skull.

definition: Toward the tail or posterior end.
example_usage: The caudal vertebrae form the tailbone.

definition: Toward or at the midline of the body.
example_usage: The nose is medial to the eyes.

definition: Away from the midline of the body.
example_usage: The ears are lateral to the nose.

definition: Closer to the point of attachment or origin.
example_usage: The elbow is proximal to the wrist.

definition: Farther from the point of attachment or origin.
example_usage: The fingers are distal to the elbow.

definition: Toward or at the body surface.
example_usage: Skin is superficial to muscles.

definition: Away from the body surface.
example_usage: Bones are deep to the skin.

definition: On the outside of a structure.
example_usage: The external surface of the skull.

definition: On the inside of a structure.
example_usage: The internal organs are protected.

definition: On the same side of the body.
example_usage: The right arm and right leg are ipsilateral.

definition: On opposite sides of the body.
example_usage: The right arm and left leg are contralateral.

definition: Pertaining to both sides of the body.
example_usage: Bilateral symmetry means mirror image.

definition: Pertaining to one side of the body.
example_usage: Unilateral weakness affects one side.

definition: Relating to the palm of the hand.
example_usage: The palmar surface has fingerprints.

definition: Relating to the back of the hand.
example_usage: The dorsal surface has visible veins.

definition: Relating to the sole of the foot.
example_usage: Plantar fasciitis affects the foot bottom.

definition: Relating to the top of the foot.
example_usage: The dorsal pedis pulse is on foot top.

definition: Toward the radius or thumb side of forearm.
example_usage: The radial artery is on the thumb side.

definition: Toward the ulna or pinky side of forearm.
example_usage: The ulnar nerve runs along pinky side.

definition: Toward the tibia or medial side of leg.
example_usage: The tibial nerve runs medially.

definition: Toward the fibula or lateral side of leg.
example_usage: The fibular artery runs laterally.

definition: Toward the nose or front of head.
example_usage: The frontal lobe is rostral to occipital.

definition: Relating to or located at the apex.
example_usage: The apical pulse is at heart apex.

definition: Relating to or located at the base.
example_usage: The basal ganglia are at brain base.

definition: At or near the center of body or structure.
example_usage: The central nervous system includes brain.

definition: Away from the center toward the surface.
example_usage: Peripheral nerves extend to limbs.

definition: Relating to the outer wall of a cavity.
example_usage: The parietal pleura lines the chest wall.

definition: Relating to internal organs or their covering.
example_usage: The visceral pleura covers the lungs.

definition: Between a medial and lateral structure.
example_usage: The intermediate cuneiform is in the midfoot.

definition: Erect standing position with arms at sides and palms forward.
example_usage: Anatomical position is used for all descriptions.

definition: Lying horizontally on the back face upward.
example_usage: The patient was placed supine for surgery.

definition: Lying horizontally on the stomach face downward.
example_usage: Prone positioning improves oxygenation.

definition: Lying on the left or right side.
example_usage: Lateral recumbent position for injections.

definition: Sitting position with head of bed elevated 45-60 degrees.
example_usage: Fowler position aids breathing.

definition: Head of bed elevated 30-45 degrees.
example_usage: Semi-Fowler reduces aspiration risk.

definition: Head of bed elevated 80-90 degrees.
example_usage: High-Fowler position for eating.

definition: Supine with head lower than feet.
example_usage: Trendelenburg position increases venous return.

definition: Supine with head higher than feet.
example_usage: Reverse Trendelenburg reduces reflux.

definition: Supine with hips and knees flexed and legs elevated.
example_usage: Lithotomy position used for pelvic exams.

definition: Left lateral position with right knee flexed.
example_usage: Sims position used for rectal examination.

definition: Kneeling with chest resting on bed.
example_usage: Knee-chest position for certain procedures.

definition: Upright position on both feet.
example_usage: Standing X-rays show weight-bearing alignment.

definition: Position with buttocks on surface and back upright.
example_usage: Sitting position for blood pressure measurement.

definition: Prone with hips elevated and flexed.
example_usage: Jackknife position for rectal surgery.

definition: Lateral recumbent with top leg flexed forward.
example_usage: Recovery position prevents aspiration.

definition: General term for any lying down position.
example_usage: Decubitus ulcers develop from prolonged pressure.

definition: Sitting upright leaning forward with arms supported.
example_usage: Orthopneic position eases breathing difficulty.

definition: Vertical plane dividing body into left and right portions.
example_usage: Sagittal plane runs front to back.

definition: Vertical plane dividing body into equal left and right halves.
example_usage: Midsagittal plane passes through midline.

definition: Vertical plane parallel to midsagittal plane off-center.
example_usage: Parasagittal plane creates unequal left and right portions.

definition: Vertical plane dividing body into anterior and posterior portions.
example_usage: Frontal plane runs side to side.

definition: Vertical plane dividing body into front and back portions.
example_usage: Coronal plane separates anterior from posterior.

definition: Horizontal plane dividing body into superior and inferior portions.
example_usage: Transverse plane creates cross-sections.

definition: Plane parallel to the ground dividing body into upper and lower.
example_usage: Horizontal plane is perpendicular to vertical.

definition: Horizontal plane perpendicular to long axis of body.
example_usage: Axial CT scans show cross-sections.

definition: Plane at an angle to the standard anatomical planes.
example_usage: Oblique X-ray shows angled view.

definition: Plane running lengthwise along the body.
example_usage: Longitudinal section shows length of structure.

definition: Plane perpendicular to long axis.
example_usage: Cross-sectional view shows internal structure.
